meanings.definition: Codens (noun): a system of symbols or letters used to represent data or information
meanings.sent1: The codens on the map helped us find our way through the forest.
meanings.sent2: She studied the codens in the ancient manuscript to decipher its meaning.
meanings.sent3: The detective cracked the case by decoding the codens left at the crime scene.
meanings.sent4: The codens of the ancient language held the key to unlocking the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The codens in the book were like a secret code waiting to be solved.

meanings.definition: Codens (verb): to assign a code to something for identification or organization
meanings.sent1: Please codens each document before filing it away.
meanings.sent2: The librarian had to codens all the new books in the system.
meanings.sent3: He decided to codens his belongings to keep track of them better.
meanings.sent4: The scientist needed to codens each sample for accurate results.
meanings.sent5: It is important to codens each item to avoid confusion later on.

meanings.definition: Codens (adjective): relating to a system of coding or symbols
meanings.sent1: The codens language was difficult to understand for beginners.
meanings.sent2: She specialized in codens systems for secure communication.
meanings.sent3: The codens puzzle was challenging but fun to solve.
meanings.sent4: His codens approach to problem-solving impressed his colleagues.
